alert.note: Alert for Eastern Teton; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:36PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Teton and northwestern Cascade Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 435 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fairfield, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Choteau, Fairfield, Dutton, Brady, Power, Collins, Pishkun Reservoir and Farmington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 303 and 333. Highway 89 between mile markers 21 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for central and north central Montana.
